section.title: Using Load Balancing as a Service (LBaaS)
section.para: Load Balancing as a Service (LBaaS) is an advanced networking service that allows load balancing of multi-node environments. It provides the ability to spread requests across multiple servers thereby reducing the load on any single server. The following examples depict usage of the various OpenStack Command Line Interfaces (CLI). The Load Balancer v1 API is also accessible via the Horizon web interface if the v1 API is enabled. The Load Balancer v2 API does not currently have a representative Horizon web interface. The v2 API is targeted to have a Horizon web interface in a future release. This document describes the configuration for LBaaS v1 and v2.
You can create TLS enabled Load Balancers in by following the steps labeled for TLS Load Balancers. You cannot enable TLS with v1 Load Balancers, only v2 Load Balancers can be enabled with TLS.

important.para: When Barbican isn't installed by default, you have to manually install Barbican and redeploy neutron.

section.para: can support either LBaaS v1 or LBaaS v2 to allow for wide ranging customer requirements. Check with your administrator for the version that is installed before starting your configuration.
